tool_usage_guide.overview: Tools and debug helpers for Calendar Diagnostic (Lite) mode.

run_commands.command: . venv/bin/activate cp .env.example .env # set DATETIME_OVERRIDE and enable debug export DATETIME_OVERRIDE="2025-10-30T00:00:00Z" export CALENDARBOT_DEBUG=true

script_guidelines.item: scripts/debug_recurring_events.py — fetches ICS, parses VEVENTs, runs expansion, writes JSON with detailed traces
scripts/test_rrule_debug.py — compares lite_rrule_expander output to python-dateutil rrule for validation
calendarbot_lite/debug_helpers.py — lightweight helper functions for debug scripts (read_env, fetch_ics_stream, etc.)

writing_debug_helpers.description: Recommended new debug helper features to add to scripts
writing_debug_helpers.item: Structured JSON output with stages: fetch, parse, expand, override_apply, selection
Per-event logs including UID, raw DTSTART string, parsed tzinfo, normalized UTC
Optional --limit N to restrict expansions for very large feeds
Optional --compare-dateutil flag to run an oracle comparison against python-dateutil

python_debug_api.description: Helper functions expected by the debug scripts

function.name: fetch_raw_ics
function.purpose: Return raw ICS string and fetch metadata (status, headers, checksum)

function.name: parse_vevents
function.purpose: Return list of parsed VEVENT dicts with UID, DTSTART raw, TZID, RRULE, EXDATE, RECURRENCE-ID

function.name: expand_rrule
function.purpose: Generate occurrence list within given window and return diagnostics (counts, truncated flag)

example_output.description: Minimal JSON structure produced by debug scripts

notes.item: Always run in the project's virtualenv; missing deps are usually due to venv not activated.
Set CALENDARBOT_DEBUG=true to produce structured logs consumed by debug scripts.
